poem:
"Morning Reverie over Coffee"

To Elton John and Viola,
links the morning paper's trivia.
Player 456, blessed with won,
Masahiro – with unease we shun.

Cosmic in years, the sun's endless hunt,
Hornsea 2 – a titan affront.
States that name elements in their honor,
And a blazing world, to illuminate our corner.

Everyday, ordinary, yet enigmatic,
Lives intertwined, braided magic.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "What links Elton John and Viola Davis? The Saturday quiz The questions 1 Player 456 won 45.6bn won on what? 2 Masahiro Mori coined what term for our unease at human-like robots? 3 A cosmic year is the time the sun takes to do what? 4 Hornsea 2 in the North Sea is the world’s largest what? 5 Which two US states give their names to chemical elements? 6 Whose Blazing World is claimed to". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
